title: Arsenal Diary : What in store this week | News
body_text:
Eindhoven and Manchester are the destinations as our men’s team face back-to-back away games this week.
Our women’s team are also getting set for Adobe Women’s FA Cup action, while the under-18s prepare for a north London derby.
Here’s some of what to look out for on Arsenal.com and the official app over the next seven days.
MONDAY
5.30pm (BST) - Mikel Arteta press conference
Shortly after touching down in Eindhoven, Mikel Arteta will be in front of the media at Philips Stadion for his pre-PSV Eindhoven press conference.
Our manager will share the latest team news and look ahead to the knockout phase of the competition.
7pm - Crystal Palace v Arsenal U21s
Back on British soil, Mehmet Ali’s young Gunners travel to the Borough Sports Ground to take on Crystal Palace in Premier League 2.
Follow the action live on X with @ArsenalAcademy, or on Instagram with ‘officialarsenalcademy’.
TUESDAY
8pm - PSV Eindhoven v Arsenal
The knockout phase of the Champions League begins as we face PSV Eindhoven away from home for the first leg of the round of 16.
For all the best build-up coverage, head to Arsenal.com and the official app, where we will have our matchday show Live From N5.
Post-match interviews, highlights and a full match replay will be published after the game.
This match will be shown live on Amazon Prime Video.
WEDNESDAY
Goal of the Month revealed
After counting up your votes, we’ll reveal the winner of February’s Emirates Goal of the Month, which encompassed strikes from our men’s, women’s and academy teams.
THURSDAY
Players of the Month revealed
February’s Players of the Month for our men’s and women’s teams will be announced on Thursday as we find out who impressed you most over the last four weeks.
FRIDAY
Times TBC - Mikel Arteta and Renee Slegers press conferences
Mikel Arteta and Renee Slegers will sit down for their pre-match press conferneces at Sobha Realty Training Centre ahead of games against Manchester United and Liverpool respectively.
SATURDAY
11am - Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal U18s
It’s derby day for Adam Birchall’s young Gunners as they travel to the Tottenham Hotspur Academy for this weekend’s U18 Premier League South clash.
Our under-18s will be looking to put last weekend's FA Youth Cup disappointment behind them and get back to winning ways.
Follow the action live on X with @ArsenalAcademy, or on Instagram with ‘officialarsenalcademy’.
SUNDAY
2.30pm - Arsenal Women v Liverpool
Knockout football returns to Mangata Pay UK Stadium as we host Liverpool in the quarter-finals of the Adobe Women’s FA Cup.
We reached this stage of the competition by beating Bristol City 5-0 in the fourth round, while Liverpool got the same result away to West Ham United.
This match will be shown live on the Women’s FA Cup YouTube channel.
4.30pm - Manchester United v Arsenal
The next entry in this classic Premier League encounter takes place at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.
For all the best build-up coverage, head to Arsenal.com and the official app, where we will have our matchday show Live From N5.
Post-match interviews, highlights and a full match replay will be published after the game.
This match will be shown live on Sky Sports.
